title: Human Resources (HR) Officer Job at Kumesoft Technology
content:
Kumesoft Technology is a growing digital marketing agency with a strong focus on SEO. Our mission is to help businesses grow by providing customized, results-driven SEO services that increase visibility, drive traffic, and boost conversions.

Starting with high-demand markets, we offer country-specific SEO strategies (e.g., “Local SEO in Nigeria,” “Local SEO in Canada”) to meet the unique needs of each region. As we build our client base and revenue, we plan to expand into PPC, social media, and content marketing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) Officer
Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Contract
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	As an HR Officer at Kumesoft Specialist, you will play a critical role in supporting the agency’s continued growth.
	You’ll be responsible for sourcing talent, overseeing onboarding, and keeping the team accountable, organized, and aligned with our mission. This role is initially a 6-month contract, with the possibility of full-time employment.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage end-to-end recruitment: post job openings, source and screen candidates, schedule interviews, and oversee onboarding.
	Keep accurate HR records and maintain internal documentation (contracts, performance reviews, leave tracking, etc.).
	Foster a work culture of accountability, clarity, and professional growth.
	Mediate internal concerns and maintain a respectful, inclusive work environment.
	Ensure policies are clearly communicated, up-to-date, and enforced across all teams.
	Monitor staff performance and attendance, providing structured feedback reports and supporting productivity.
	Organize internal communications, including meetings, task follow-ups, and company-wide updates.
	Support leadership in planning staff development activities (training, team-building, etc.).
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian labor laws and HR best practices.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
	Prior experience in a dedicated HR role, preferably in a fast-paced or digital-focused company.
	Deep understanding of HR operations, recruitment processes, and labor regulations.
	Exceptional organizational and interpersonal skills.
	Proven ability to work independently and manage remote teams.
	Tech-savvy and proficient in HR tools, digital task managers (e.g., Trello), and communication tools (e.g., Google Meet).
	Strong communication skills with high emotional intelligence.


Contract & Growth Opportunity


	This is a 6-month contract position. If performance goals are met and the role proves to be integral to the company’s growth, there is a strong potential for full-time employment.
	We’re looking for someone who brings structure, clarity, and lasting value to the team.


Salary
N70,000 - N100,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: hello@rankreform.com using “HR Officer” as the subject of the mail.

title: Web Developer Job at Just Inches Limited
content:
Just Inches Limited is a premier strategic communications company dedicated to helping talents, corporate organizations, and nations discover their unique positioning, craft and convey their messages effectively, and enhance their brand image. Our mission is to improve and sustain perspectives, relationships, and brand recognition, driving increased reach, visibility, engagement, and return on investment for our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Web Developer
Job Location: Lekki-Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type:

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Design, develop, and maintain modern, responsive, and secure websites using WordPress and custom programming where necessary.
	Customize themes and plugins to meet specific client and project needs.
	Collaborate with creative, content, and business development teams to ensure alignment with brand guidelines and objectives.
	Optimize websites for performance, SEO, and mobile responsiveness.
	Troubleshoot website issues, bugs, and server-side errors.
	Ensure proper website security, backups, and uptime.
	Maintain documentation of code, updates, and processes for internal use.
	Manage hosting, domain configurations, and third-party integrations.


Requirements


	Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Web Developer (agency or client-side).
	Proven expertise in WordPress CMS – including theme development, plugin customization, and WooCommerce.
	Strong command of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, PHP, and MySQL.
	Graphic design skills (using tools like Figma, Adobe XD, Canva, or Photoshop) are an added advantage.
	Experience with APIs, third-party integrations, and version control systems (e.g., Git).
	Understanding of SEO best practices and web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics).
	Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines under pressure.


What We Offer


	A creative and collaborative work environment
	Opportunities for growth in a performance-driven team
	Competitive salary and project-based bonuses
	Flexible work structure with room for innovation.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, portfolio (with links to previous WordPress and web development work), and a brief cover letter to: hr@justinches.net using  “Application - Web Developer” as the subject of the email.

title: Communications Manager Job at Phillips Outsourcing Limited
content:
Phillips Outsourcing Limited has been in existence for over 16 years. We have a vast experience in the outsourcing business as we currently manage resources for major clients in all sectors of the Nigerian economy. In addition, our prolific manpower cuts across the 36 states in Nigeria. After successfully gaining ground in all the 36 states of the federation, we are gradually spreading our tentacles to other African Nations. We are currently registered to also do business in Ghana. Our framework is developed to fully support the businesses of our clients, ensuring continuous improvement of the outsourced services. This ultimately thrusts our clients to achieve their business objectives.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Communications Manager
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Indusrty: Media

Job Summary


	We are currently hiring a skilled and experienced Communications Manager to lead our communications strategy and initiatives.
	This role is pivotal to driving our brand’s voice, enhancing engagement with our audience, and solidifying our position as a trusted source of African stories.
	The ideal candidate is an adept storyteller with a strong media network, a strategic mindset, tasteful execution, and a passion for promoting African journalism.


Responsibilities


	Craft and execute a comprehensive communications strategy that aligns with the organizations mission and goals.
	Develop compelling messaging across various platforms, including press releases, newsletters, social media, and website content
	Establish and maintain strong relationships with media outlets, journalists, and influencers. Proactively pitch stories and respond to media inquiries to ensure high-quality coverage.
	Safeguard and strengthen the organizations brand identity, ensuring all communications reflect our core values and mission.
	Oversee social media presence, creating strategies that engage followers, build community, and increase brand visibility.
	Lead and coordinate communications campaigns, audience surveys and collaborative partnerships to enhance audience reach and engagement.
	Collaborate with our sales team to drive sales and customer satisfaction through our digital and social media platforms.
	Manage communications for special events, such as editorial launches, interviews, and public panels, to maximize audience participation and engagement.
	Track and report on key metrics related to communications efforts. Use data-driven insights to refine strategies and improve outcomes.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in communications, social sciences or a related field
	5+ years of full-time professional experience in a communications or public relations role, preferably in media or publishing.
	Proven track record of managing successful communications campaigns, conducting surveys and building media relationships
	Exceptional writing, editing, and verbal communication skills. (Demonstrable graphics and/or video editing experience is a big plus.)
	Strong understanding of digital marketing, social media and newsletter strategy, and analytics.
	Proficiency with social media and newsletter design tools such as Buffer, Later, Canva and Mailchimp as well as extensive experience with productivity tools such as Notion and the Microsoft Office Suite.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
	Strong organizational and time-management abilities.
	Ability to anticipate needs and handle multiple priorities.
	Passion for African journalism and an understanding of the unique challenges and opportunities in the African media landscape.


Salary
N700,000 Monthly (Net).

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: realrecruitment.jobs@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
